segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed the water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's been pouring out for quite some time now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting larger and larger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm surprised she hasn't slipped yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking cookies like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don't like how they're behaving.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall if he's not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would do something about this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen is going to be ruined if the water keeps overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the garden outside, it looks so nice and calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's too bad the inside of the house isn't as peaceful.
segments.speaker: PAR
